thread.title: Bulldogs offense runs circles around Atkins
thread.title_full: Bulldogs offense runs circles around Atkins

author: Cameron Tate (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Bulldogs offense runs circles around Atkins
text: Bulldogs offense runs circles around Atkins by Cameron Tate The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:37 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 25 views | 0 | 0 | | ATKINS — The muddy conditions after the rain on Friday didn’t help the Atkins Red Devils during their 43-12 loss to the Bald Knob Bulldogs at Sorrels Stadium at Lemley Field.Bald Knob came out strong and took Atkins by surprise early. After a brief seven-play possession and punt by Atkins, Bald Knob scored a touchdown on its first play, with an 80-yard run by Bulldogs quarterback Clayton Collins. The PAT was no good, making the score 6-0 for Bald Knob.The Bulldogs scored on their next possession after a four-play drive on an 80-yard drive capped by a 15-yard touchdown pass from Collins. The PAT was good, putting the Bulldogs at 13-0 early in the game.Atkins started to make a comeback with an 8-play drive before a turnover to Bald Knob. Bald Knob took advantage of the possession and scored a 35-yard field goal after 13-play drive, making the score 16-0 for Bald Knob.The Bulldogs scored their third touchdown after only one play after receiving the punt. Their PAT was good to go 23-0.Atkins scored on a six-play drive to pull within 23-6, but a missed PAT kick left the score right there. Bald Knob went up 30-6 early in the third quarter. Seth Haney’s pass was intercepted for a touchdown on the next Red Devils drive to make it 36-6. Bald Knob later made it 42-6 at the end of the third quarter with a 33-yard run to cap a two-playh drive. Brandon Haney scored the second Red Devils’ touchdown after an eight-play, 75-yard drive. Devin Dollar pulled in the 2-point conversion to make it 43-12.Atkins will travel to Barton on Friday.
